means: 麻絮，填絮（用于填塞船缝）

sentence.Network_en: Shipbuilders caulk wooden boats with oakum and tar.
sentence.Network_cn: 造船工匠用麻丝和沥青填塞木船缝隙,使之不渗水.

sentence.Network_en: Nautical To make a boat watertight by packing seams a waterproof material, as oakum or pitch.
sentence.Network_cn: 使用防水材料, 如麻絮或沥青堵漏缝以使(船)不漏水.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ācumbe, literally 'off-combings'. The current sense dates from Middle English

means.word_mean: 1. loose hemp or jute fiber obtained by unravelling old ropes; when impregnated with tar it was used to caulk seams and pack joints in wooden ships
